title: Nate Robinson
summary: Nathaniel Cornelius Robinson (born May 31, 1984) is an American former professional basketball player. Born in Seattle, Robinson played college basketball for the University of Washington[1] in Seattle and was the 21st pick in the 2005 NBA draft. The 5-foot-9-inch (1.75Â m) point guard played in the NBA for the New York Knicks, Boston Celtics,[2] Oklahoma City Thunder, Golden State Warriors, Chicago Bulls,[3] Denver Nuggets, Los Angeles Clippers, and New Orleans Pelicans. Robinson became the NBA's first three-time slam dunk champion in 2010.[4]
